data.torque: 617 or 651 N⋅m (455 or 480 lb⋅ft) at 6,700 rpm

notes: The BMW M70 engine, produced from 1987 to 1994, is a 5.0 L V12 engine with a 60° configuration. It features an aluminum cylinder block and head, a single overhead camshaft (SOHC) valvetrain, and operates on petrol. The engine delivers a power output of 220 kW (295 hp) and a torque output of 450 N⋅m (332 lb⋅ft). The M70 has no direct predecessor and was succeeded by the BMW M73 engine.
